full_text:
Page 311

RE: Epstein update
From (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USANYS)
To (b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
Date 2019/08/10 16:14
Subject: RE: Epstein update
Attachments: TEXT.htm, Mime.822

(b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
I'll call you separately in a moment, but just in case email is faster, I just received a phone call from defense counsel that a person close to Mr. Epstein received a phone call from an individual named (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (phonetic) who claimed to be an investigator with the MCC and told the individual that Mr. Epstein's body was ready to be picked up at the hospital and that the individual could make arrangements for retrieval of the body. (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) left his phone number as 646-836(b)(6); (b)(7)(C).

Can you please confirm whether that individual is in fact with BOP and/or MCC? Defense counsel is understandably concerned that they (and others with connections with Mr. Epstein) are starting to get hoax or otherwise inaccurate information through phone calls and emails. And we would again respectfully but urgently request that if there is information like this that needs to go to representatives for Mr. Epstein, that it come to us so we can pass it along to his counsel with confidence that it is true and accurate.

(Separately, if it is accurate that BOP / MCC is prepared to release Mr. Epstein's body, his defense counsel is extremely concerned about whether that has been enough time for a full autopsy and any other investigative steps, and we would want to confirm that the FBI team addressing this matter has also been informed—but that's only if this is not a hoax, obviously.)

Please advise as soon as possible, as the individual is waiting to know whether they should take steps to retrieve the body.

thank you,
(b)(6); (b)(7)(C)

From: (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USANYS) [b)(6); (b)(7)(C)@usa.doj.gov]
Sent: Saturday, August 10, 2019 15:56
To: (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @bop.gov (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USANYS)
(b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @usa.doj.gov (b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
Cc: (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) USANYS (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @usms.doj.gov (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USMS)
Subject: RE: Epstein update

Hi (b)(6); (b)(7)(C)

I'm checking in to see if you're able to provide us with additional information. I'm 646-618(b)(6); (b)(7)(C) when you have a moment.

Thanks,
(b)(6); (b)(7)(C)

Page 775
DOJ-OGR-00024846

From (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USANYS)
To (b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
Date 2019/08/10 16:14
Subject: RE: Epstein update
Attachments: TEXT.htm, Mime.822

I'll call you separately in a moment, but just in case email is faster, I just received a phone call from defense counsel that a person close to Mr. Epstein received a phone call from an individual named (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (phonetic) who claimed to be an investigator with the MCC and told the individual that Mr. Epstein's body was ready to be picked up at the hospital and that the individual could make arrangements for retrieval of the body. (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) left his phone number as 646-836(b)(6); (b)(7)(C).

Can you please confirm whether that individual is in fact with BOP and/or MCC? Defense counsel is understandably concerned that they (and others with connections with Mr. Epstein) are starting to get hoax or otherwise inaccurate information through phone calls and emails. And we would again respectfully but urgently request that if there is information like this that needs to go to representatives for Mr. Epstein, that it come to us so we can pass it along to his counsel with confidence that it is true and accurate.

(Separately, if it is accurate that BOP / MCC is prepared to release Mr. Epstein's body, his defense counsel is extremely concerned about whether that has been enough time for a full autopsy and any other investigative steps, and we would want to confirm that the FBI team addressing this matter has also been informed—but that's only if this is not a hoax, obviously.)
Please advise as soon as possible, as the individual is waiting to know whether they should take steps to retrieve the body.

From: (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USANYS) [b)(6); (b)(7)(C)@usa.doj.gov]
Sent: Saturday, August 10, 2019 15:56
To: (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @bop.gov (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USANYS)
(b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @usa.doj.gov (b)(6); (b)(7)(C)
Cc: (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) USANYS (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) @usms.doj.gov (b)(6); (b)(7)(C) (USMS)
Subject: RE: Epstein update

Hi (b)(6); (b)(7)(C)

I'm checking in to see if you're able to provide us with additional information. I'm 646-618(b)(6); (b)(7)(C) when you have a moment.

additional_notes: The document appears to be a redacted email correspondence related to the Epstein case. Multiple sections of the text are redacted, indicating sensitive or personal information has been removed. The document is from the Department of Justice (DOJ) and contains communications between various DOJ components and other agencies.
